citations.narrative:
On December 25, 2022, when two wolf/hybrids were returned to their primary enclosure, the owner failed to close the
gate securely to prevent escape. These two wolf/hybrids were able to come in contact with a smaller wolf/hybrid that was
housed in an adjacent enclosure. The smaller wolf/hybrid’s right, front leg was significantly injured to the point that the
limb required amputation. The enclosure gate was not maintained properly so that it could contain the wolf/hybrids
securely and protect other wolf/hybrids from injury.
A method to ensure that gates are appropriately secured should be implemented to protect the wolf/hybrids from injury.
Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that they protect the wolf/hybrids from injury and contain them
securely.
TO BE CORRECTED FROM THIS DAY FORWARD: JANUARY 20, 2023
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the facility representatives and licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
JESSICA GOWINS, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICEREnd Section

narrative:
3.6(a)(2)(v)  Critical
   
Primary enclosures. 
On December 25, 2022, when two wolf/hybrids were returned to their primary enclosure, the owner failed to close the 
gate securely to prevent escape.  These two wolf/hybrids were able to come in contact with a smaller wolf/hybrid that was 
housed in an adjacent enclosure.  The smaller wolf/hybrid’s right, front leg was significantly injured to the point that the 
limb required amputation.  The enclosure gate was not maintained properly so that it could contain the wolf/hybrids 
securely and protect other wolf/hybrids from injury. 
A method to ensure that gates are appropriately secured should be implemented to protect the wolf/hybrids from injury.  
Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that they protect the wolf/hybrids from injury and contain them 
securely. 
 
TO BE CORRECTED FROM THIS DAY FORWARD:  JANUARY 20, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the facility representatives and licensee. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
JESSICA GOWINS, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICEREnd Section
